subject: Ski Jumping
lead_paragraph: Thomas Morgenstern of Austria won the large-hill event Saturday in Engelberg, Switzerland. He is the first ski jumper to open a World Cup season with six victories in a row. He had jumps of 132.5 and 133.0 meters for 260.4 total points, finishing ahead of his compatriot Andreas Kofler.Morgenstern is tied with Janne Ahonen and Matti Hautamaki, each of Finland, for most consecutive victories at any point in a season. He can claim the record for himself Sunday, in another large-hill event.
